clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Investigation of CRBSI, VAP, CAUTI in Chinese ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Colonization and Infection in Critically Ill Patients: a Multicenter, Prospective, Observational Study in Intensive Care Units (ICUs) in China

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The current protocol desires to implement a large-multicenter observational study of hospital acquired infection in ICU in China. The study will generate data on generate data about the epidemiology current management of nosocomial infection.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objectives are as followings:
1. Obtain incidence of three major nosocomial infection in ICU, catheter related blood stream infection(CRBSI), catheter related urinary tract infection (CRUTI), and ventilator associated pneumonia (VAP).
2. Determine the epidemic of etiology and condition of management of three major nosocomial infection in ICU in China.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: the incidence rate of VAP, CRBSI,CAUTI of critical ill patients in Chinese ICU

study_pop.textblock: All patients admitted into ICU are eligible for this study. All the infected patients were treated by the attending physician, and the choice and adjustment of antibiotic were in accordance with the recommendations of ATS guidelines.

criteria.textblock: Inclusion Criteria:all patients admitted into ICU
